Cursorë€? ì •ì˜ Cursor contract to handle fetching items lazily using an Iterator. Cursors are a perfect fit to handle millions of items queries that would not normally fit in memory.

Synchronized Synchronizedë€? The Java programming language provides two basic synchronization idioms:Â synchronized methodsÂ andÂ synchronized statements. The more complex of the two, synchronized statements, are described in the next section. This section is about synchronized methods.

User interfaces and operating systems use system-dependentÂ pathname stringsÂ to name files and directories. This class presents an abstract, system-independent view of hierarchical pathnames.

item.title: Reflection
item.description: Reflectionì´ë€? ì •ì˜ Reflection enables Java code to discover information about the fields, methods and constructors of loaded classes, and to use reflected fields, methods, and constructors to operate on their underlying counterparts, within security restrictions. The API accommodates applications that need access to either the public members of a target object (based on its runtime class) or the members declared by a given class. It also allows programs to suppress default reflective access control.
